body: Sorry, won't fix, without example we can't help you

> Sorry, won't fix, without example we can't help you

Understood. Will try and make a minimal example.

Same issue here, I'm using Laravel Mix but no jQuery in the mix here, downgrading to `5.24.4` from `5.25.0` resolved the issue.

**What is the current behaviour?**

JS is not being executed client-side, I can't even get a `console.log()` output. No errors in the console either.

**What is the expected behaviour?**

JS should be executed client-side.

**Other relevant information:**

webpack version: 5.25.0
Node.js version: 14.15.4
Operating System: Windows 10
Additional tools: Laravel Mix
I thing bug on `Laravel Mix` side, as you can see no reports from other developers
Bug without example I can't help
Inevitably, my minimal example doesn't have the problem.  :( However it looks in the 'broken' version, all the js chunks are loaded but Webpack never "runs" them.
What is output of `dist` and generated `index.html`?

> What is output of `dist` and generated `index.html`?

My HTML is unchanged (Webpack isn't generating that).

Relevant section snipped is 
```
    <script src="/js/manifest.js?id=c7e3addb28db6d509f49"></script>
    <script src="/js/vendor.js?id=d425ac29b17e87266a7d"></script>
    <script src="/js/app.js?id=ce0df1181fd5328cf69f"></script>

    <script>console.log($)</script> -- crashes here
```
`dist` contains all the expected files.  Generated JS files seem identical apart from the last few lines. I can post an example of those if that helps?

In manifest.js there's this code, which I think is the actual module "runner".  It seems that `__webpack_require__.o()` is always returning false for these modules so they never get run...?
```
	if (__webpack_require__.o(installedChunks, chunkId) && installedChunks[chunkId]) {
		installedChunks[chunkId][0]();
```
Not all modules write yourself to `window`, so using `$` is not safe here, do you have `window.jQuery`?

issue.title: Possibly a Mix issue with webpack 5.25?

repository.name: laravel-mix
repository.description: The power of webpack, distilled for the rest of us.

issue.body:
-   Laravel Mix Version: #.#.# 6.0.13
-   Node Version 14.12.0
-   NPM Version 1.22.5
-   OS:Windows 

### Description: 
Just a heads-up that the latest Webpack build seems to have introduced behaviour that impacts some Mix users.  Unclear yet if it's a Mix problem or a Webpack one :(

https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/12880

Basically, Webpack loads your modules but doesn't run them...

### Steps To Reproduce:
It's complicated...

body:
> Not all modules write yourself to `window`, so using `$` is not safe here, do you have `window.jQuery`?

 I'd get the same problem. My `app.ts`  starts with

```
import * as $ from "jquery"

window["$"] = $
```
... But that code is never executed because Webpack never 'runs' the modules it loads.  Breakpoints on that line are never hit in 5.25, but they are in previous 5.x builds.

This is very likely a bug in webpack. We did some refactoring to the startup logic.

You said only a few lines changed. Maybe you can post the diff?

> This is very likely a bug in webpack. We did some refactoring to the startup logic.
> 
> You said only a few lines changed. Maybe you can post the diff?

I'm about to publish a small repo which demonstrates the issue. It's triggered by including a .scss file via mix. webpack thinks the load is not 'fulfilled' because it never 'sees' the scss file being loaded...
Ah that's possible if you have a chunk with only css and no JS, due to splitChunks.

Hi! I'm one of the people who works on Mix. I'd be happy to help where I can with this!

> Ah that's possible if you have a chunk with only css and no JS, due to splitChunks.

Yep this happens because we split CSS using `splitChunks` with a filename test + type: css/mini-extract + enforce: true

issue.title: Gatsby 3 build does not include or execute javascript

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: An issue or pull request relating to a bug in Gatsby

labels.name: type: upstream
labels.description: Issues outside of Gatsby's control, caused by dependencies

repository.name: gatsby
repository.description: The best React-based framework with performance, scalability and security built in.

issue.body:
## Description

When using `gatsby build` no javascript work on the page.

### Steps to reproduce

In `src\gatsby\components\layout.js`.

```
if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {
    require('myscript')
}

export default class Layout extends React.Component {
  componentDidMount() {
    console.log('test')
```

### Expected result

`console.log` and `myscript` should execute

### Actual result

No console messages

### Environment

```
  System:
    OS: Windows 10 10.0.19042
    CPU: (8) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-9700 CPU @ 3.00GHz
  Binaries:
    Node: 12.18.0 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.EXE
    Yarn: 1.22.10 - ~\AppData\Roaming\npm\yarn.CMD
    npm: 6.14.8 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\npm.CMD
  Languages:
    Python: 2.7.15
  Browsers:
    Chrome: 89.0.4389.82
    Edge: Spartan (44.19041.423.0), Chromium (89.0.774.50)
  npmPackages:
    gatsby: ^3.0.4 => 3.0.4
    gatsby-plugin-catch-links: ^3.0.0 => 3.0.0
    gatsby-plugin-manifest: ^3.0.0 => 3.0.0
    gatsby-plugin-module-resolver: ^1.0.3 => 1.0.3
    gatsby-plugin-page-creator: ^3.0.0 => 3.0.0
    gatsby-plugin-postcss: ^4.0.0 => 4.0.0
    gatsby-plugin-react-helmet: ^4.0.0 => 4.0.0
    gatsby-plugin-sitemap: ^3.0.0 => 3.0.0
    gatsby-remark-classes: ^1.0.0 => 1.0.0
    gatsby-remark-component: ^1.1.3 => 1.1.3
    gatsby-remark-custom-blocks: ^3.0.0 => 3.0.0
    gatsby-remark-external-links: ^0.0.4 => 0.0.4
    gatsby-source-contentful: 5.0.3 => 5.0.3
    gatsby-source-filesystem: ^3.0.0 => 3.0.0
    gatsby-source-prismic: ^3.3.4 => 3.3.4
    gatsby-transformer-remark: ^3.0.0 => 3.0.0
  npmGlobalPackages:
    gatsby-dev-cli: 2.7.23
    gatsby: 2.25.3
```

issue.title: fix problem with startup of non-js initial chunks

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.
